Description: Large wooden standing high-relief profile figure of a goddess, probably Isis or Nephthys, from a shrine. Faces right with winged arms outstretched and has an uraeus on the brow. All the surface is gilded with details in inlays of blue and red glass, although many of the sockets for the inlays are now empty. The wig and wings were heavily inlaid. There is a plinth below the feet. In front of the figure is part of a representation of the door of the shrine.
